00285 
00286         struct MemPoolBlockInfo;
00287 
00288         struct MemPoolBufferInfo
00289         {
00290             uint32 iBufferPreFence;     // Pre-fence to check for memory corruption
00291             OsclAny* iStartAddr;        // Starting memory address of the memory pool buffer after the buffer info
00292             OsclAny* iEndAddr;          // Ending memory address of the memory pool buffer
00293             uint32 iBufferSize;         // Total size of the memory pool buffer including the buffer info header
00294             uint32 iNumOutstanding;     // Number of outstanding blocks from this memory pool buffer
00295             MemPoolBlockInfo* iNextFreeBlock; // Pointer to the next free memory block
00296             uint32 iAllocatedSz;        //Number of butes allocated from the mempool
00297             uint32 iBufferPostFence;    // Post-fence to check for memory corruption
00298         };
00299 
00300         struct MemPoolBlockInfo
00301         {
00302             uint32 iBlockPreFence;      // Pre-fence to check for memory corruption
00303             MemPoolBlockInfo* iNextFreeBlock; // Pointer to the next (right neighbor) free block in the buffer. NULL if none.
00304             MemPoolBlockInfo* iPrevFreeBlock; // Pointer to the previous (left neighbor) free block in the buffer. NULL if first free block
00305             uint32 iBlockSize;          // Total size of the block including the block info header
00306             uint8* iBlockBuffer;        // Pointer to the buffer area of the block
00307             MemPoolBufferInfo* iParentBuffer; // Pointer to the block's parent memory pool buffer
00308             uint32 iBlockPostFence;     // Post-fence to check for memory corruption
00309         };
00310 
00311     protected:
00312 
00315         OSCL_IMPORT_REF virtual ~OsclMemPoolResizableAllocator();

00321         void deallocateblock(MemPoolBlockInfo& aBlockPtr);
